Content: My lawyer? [Scott is taken to a room where Pym is sat waiting for him]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I told you Id be in touch, Scott. Im starting to think that you prefer the inside of a jail cell.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Oh, man.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Sit down. [we see ants crawling over the camera in the room to obscure the conversation]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Sir, Im sorry I stole the suit. I dont even want to know why you have it.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Maggie was right about you.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: How do you know about… ?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: The way shes trying to keep you away from Cassie. The moment things get hard, you turn right back to crime. The way I see it, you have a choice. You can either spend the rest of your life in prison or go back to your cell and await further instructions.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I dont understand.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: No, I dont expect you to. But you dont have many options right now. Quite frankly, neither do I. Why do you think I let you steal that suit in the first place?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: What? [flashback to Pym giving money to his housekeeper, Emily, so that she can tip Luiss friends to tip off about the job]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Second chances dont come around all that much. So next time you think you might see one I suggest you take a real close look at it. [Pym rises and leaves the room]

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: [referring to the ugly rabbit toy Scott gave her as Maggie is putting Cassie to sleep] Are you sure you dont want a different toy?

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: Are you sure you dont want a different toy?

Speaker: Cassie Lang
Content: No, I love this one.

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: Okay. Well, get some sleep then. I love you. [Maggie kisses Cassie on her head]

Speaker: Cassie Lang
Content: Mommy?

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: Hm?

Speaker: Cassie Lang
Content: Is daddy a bad man? I heard some grownups say hes bad.

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: No. Daddy just gets confused sometimes, you know? [as Scott is sat in his cell thinking several ants bring Scott the suit in its tiny form then enlarge it so that Scott can wear it, he quickly slip into it, zaps himself small to escape]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Smart choice. You actually listened for once. [Scott runs out of the cell]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Under the door. [as the prison alarm goes off Scott runs out of the building]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Okay. Where to now?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hang tight. [some ants approach Scott]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: What? What?! [inside the police station]

Speaker: Paxton
Content: Where the hell did he go?

Speaker: Detective
Content: I have no idea, he just vanished. [into his radio] Set up a five block perimeter, now! [back to Scott; to the ants]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Get back, get back, get back!

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Scott, these are my associates.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Huh? You got a camera on an ant? Yeah, sure, why not? Wheres the car?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: No car, weve got wings. Incoming! [a large winged ant flies over Scott and lands in front of him]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Put your foot on the central node and not the thorax.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Are you ki… ? How safes this… ?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Get on the damn ant, Scott! [Scott gets on the ant and as it flies off the police go on a manhunt for him] [the winged ant has landed on a police car thats looking for Scott]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Why am I on a police car? Shouldnt I not be on a police car?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: So they can give you a lift past their five block perimeter.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Whoa. Alright. Now, whats the next move?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hang on tight.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Oh, this is easy. Im getting the hang of this. Yank up to go up. Its like a horse.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Youre throwing 2-47 off balance.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Wait, his name is 2-47?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: He doesnt have a name, he has a number Scott. Do you have any idea how many ants there are? [as the police car swerves]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Whoa!

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Maybe its 2-48. [as the ant flies up]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: No, no, no, no! Vertigo, vertigo!

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: No, I think its 2-47.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Wait.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hang on.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I think Im getting the hang of this. [as ant flies Scott around the city]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Im controlling 2-47. He is not listening to you.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: What? Can I make one little request?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: No.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Stop 2-47. Time out, time out. Time out. Alright, hold on. Just, wait. Whoa, uh! What happens if I throw up in this helmet?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Its my helmet, Scott. Do not throw up.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Just set her down, alright? Im getting light headed.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hang on, Scott.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Yeah, Im getting a little light… its funny… hit me, and… [as the ant continues to fly Scott feels dizzy and falls off the ants back] [Scott wakes up in a bedroom and jumps up in shock when he sees Hope watching over him]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Hello. Who are you? Have you been standing there watching me sleep this whole time?

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Yes.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Why?

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Because the last time you were here you stole something.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Oh. Oh! Hey, look. [Scott goes to get out of bed but recoils when he sees insects crawling all over the floor]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Whoa!

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Paraponera clavata. Giant tropical bullet ants. Ranked highest on the Schmidt pain index. Theyre here to keep an eye on you when I cant. Dr. Pyms waiting for you downstairs. [she turns and walks out of the room]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Who? [calling out to Hope] Hey, um, whose pajamas are these? [gets no response] How am I supposed to do this? [Scott puts his foot down tentatively onto the floor and the ants make space for his foot]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Right, just one step at a time. [he slowly stops towards the door as the ants make room for his feet]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Ugh. You dont bite me, I dont step on you, deal? [in the dining hall]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Take down the servers and Cross wouldnt even know it. We dont need this guy. [Scott enters the dining room where Pym and Hope are sat]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I assume that youve already met my daughter Hope.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I did. Shes great.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: She doesnt think that we need you.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: We dont. We can do this ourselves.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I go to all this effort to let you steal my suit, and then Hope has you arrested.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Okay, we can try this and when he fails Ill do it myself.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Shes a little bit anxious. It has to do with this job, which, judging by the fact that youre sitting opposite me, I take it that youre interested in.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: What job?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Would you like some tea?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Uh, sure. [Pym pours Scott some tea]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I was very impressed with how you managed to get past my security system. Freezing that metal was particularly clever.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Were you watching me?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Scott, Ive been watching you for a while, ever since you robbed Vista Corp. Oh, excuse me, burgled Vista Corp. [Scott see Hope smile to herself] Vistas security system is one of the most advanced in the business. Its supposed to be unbeatable but you beat it. Would you like some sugar?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Yeah, thanks. [he sees two ants pushing two sugar cubes on the table towards his cup] You know what, Im okay. [referring to the ants] How do you make them do that?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Ants can lift objects fifty times their weight. They build, farm, they cooperate with each other.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Right. But how do you make them do that? [he sees the ants returning the sugar cubes into their bowl]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I use electromagnetic waves to stimulate their olfactory nerve center. I speak to them. I can go anywhere, hear anything, and see everything.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: And still know absolutely nothing. Im late to meet Cross. [Hope gets up and leaves] [Scott raises his hand to ask a question]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Uh… Dr. Pym?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: You dont need to raise your hand, Scott.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Sorry, I just have one question. Who are you? Who is she? What the hells going on and can I go back to jail now?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Come with me. [Pym takes Scott to his lab] Twenty years ago I created a formula that altered atomic relative distance.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Huh?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I learned how to change the distance between atoms, thats what powers the suit, thats why it works. [they enter Pyms lab]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Whoa.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: But it was dangerous. It was too dangerous. So I hid it from the world. And thats when I switched gears and I started my own company.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Pym Tech.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Yes. I took on a young protégé called Darren Cross.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Darren Cross. Hes a big deal.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: But before he was a big deal he was my assistant. I thought I saw something in him, a son I never had perhaps. He was brilliant, but as we became close he began to suspect that I wasnt telling him everything. He heard rumors about what was called the Pym Particles, and he became obsessed with recreating my formula. But I wouldnt help him so he conspired against me and he voted me out of my own company.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: How could he do that?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: The boards chairman is my daughter, Hope. She was the deciding vote. But she came back to me when she saw how close Cross was to cracking my formula. The process is highly volatile. What isnt protected by a specialized helmet can affect the brains chemistry. I dont think Darren realizes this, and you know, hes not the most stable guy to begin with.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: So, what do you want from me?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Scott, I believe that everyone deserves a shot at redemption. Do you?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I do.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: If you can help me, I promise I can help you be with your daughter again. Now are you ready to redeem yourself?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Absolutely. My days of breaking into places and stealing shit are done. What do you want me to do?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I want you to break into a place and steal some shit. [Paxton receives a text from his partner, Gale, as hes sat having breakfast with Maggie and Cassie]

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: You going to be home for dinner tonight? [Paxton reads the text, “Langs “Lawyer” is Dr. Hank Pym, as in Pym Tech]

Speaker: Paxton
Content: Uh, yeah. Ill pick something up, text you.

Speaker: Maggie Lang
Content: Okay. Good news? [Paxton gets up to leave]

Speaker: Paxton
Content: Uh, I dont know. Its news.

Speaker: Cassie Lang
Content: Are you trying to find my daddy?

Speaker: Paxton
Content: Yeah, I am, sweetheart. I just want your daddy to be safe.

Speaker: Cassie Lang
Content: Hope you dont catch him. [Pym is showing Scott photos of the people he used to worked with]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: This isnt the first time these guys have tried to get their hands on game changing weaponry. Thats Mitchell Carson, ex-head of defense at SHIELD, presently in the business of toppling governments. He always wanted my tech, and now, unless we break in and steal the Yellowjacket and destroy all the data, Darren Cross is gonna unleash chaos upon the world.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I think our first move should be calling the Avengers.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Ive spent half my life trying to keep this technology out of the hands of a Stark. Im sure as hell not gonna hand-deliver it to one now. This is not some cute technology like the Iron Man suit. This could change the texture of reality. Besides theyre probably too busy dropping cities out of the sky.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Okay, then why dont you just send the ants?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Scott, they are ants. Ants, they can do a lot of things, but they still need a leader. Somebody that can infiltrate a place thats designed to prevent infiltration.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Hank, Im a thief. Alright? Im a good thief. But this is insane. [just then Hope enters the lab]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Hes right Hank and you know it. Youve seen the footage, you know what Cross is capable of. I was against using him when we had months, now we have days. Im wearing the suit.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Absolutely not!

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: I know the facility inside and out, I know how Cross thinks. I know this mission better than anybody here.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: We need you close to Cross otherwise this mission cannot work.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: We dont have time to screw around.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hope, please. Listen to me, please…

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: He is a criminal. Im your daughter.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: No! [Pym turns and sits down, Hope walks off in disappointment]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Shes right, Hank. Im not your guy. Why dont you wear the suit?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: You think I dont want to? I cant. I spent years wearing it. It took a toll on me. Youre our only option. Before Hope lost her mother, she used to look at me like I was the greatest man in the world. And now she looks at me and its just disappointment. Its too late for me, but not for you. This is your chance. The chance to earn that look in your daughters eyes, to become the hero that she already thinks you are. Its not about saving our world, its about saving theirs.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Damn, that was a good speech.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Scott, I need you to be the Ant-Man. [we see Scott wearing the Ant-Man suit with Pym and Hope training him]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: In the right hands, the relationship between man and suit is symbiotic. The suit has power, the man harnesses that power. You need to be skillful, agile, and above all, you need to be fast. You should be able to shrink and grow on a dime, so your size always suits your needs. [Hope closes the door] Now dive through the keyhole, Scott. You charge big, you dive small, then you emerge big. [Scott puts on the helmet and charges for the keyhole]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Ow! [we hear him fail several times as he continues to shrink and dive through the keyhole] Ah! Ow.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: [to Pym] Useless. [Hope trains Scott]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: When youre small energy is compressed so you have the force of a two hundred pound man behind a fist a hundredth of an inch wide, youre like a bullet. You punch too hard, you kill someone, too soft, its a love-tap. In other words you have to know how to punch.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I was in prison for three years, I know how to punch.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Show me. [she puts up her hands and Scott hits her hand] Terrible.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: You want to show me how to punch? [he puts up his hand like hers] Show me… [suddenly Hope punches him in the face knocking him back]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Thats how you punch.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Shes been looking forward to this.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: No kiddin.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hope trained in martial arts at a, uh, difficult time.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Oh, by difficult time, he means when my mother died.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: We lost her in a plane crash.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Its bad enough you wont tell me how she died, could you please stop telling me that lie. Were working here. [as Scott is still recovering from her punch] Alright princess, lets get back to work.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Were you going for the hand? [Pym finds Scott playing around with the suits regulator]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: You know, I think this regulator is holding me back.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Do not screw with the regulator. If that regulator is compromised you would go sub-atomic.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: What does that mean?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: It means that you would enter a quantum realm.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: What does *that* mean?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: It means that you would enter a reality where all concepts of time and space become irrelevant as you shrink for all eternity. Everything that you know, and love, gone forever.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Cool. Yeah. Im… if it aint broke. [return to training]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Youve learned about the suit, but youve yet to learn about your

Speaker: greatest allies
Content: the ants. Loyal, brave, and your partners on this job. [Pym and Hope watch as Scott shrinks in their back garden and goes running under the earth]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Paratrechina longicornis, commonly known as crazy ants, theyre lightning fast and can conduct electricity which makes them useful to fry out enemy electronics. [Scott comes across a crazy ant]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Oh, youre not so crazy. [the crazy ant jumps on him, knocking Scott back] Hey! Youre cute. [suddenly a herd of crazy ants crawl all over Scott] Oh! Aaah! [Scott turns himself back to normal size and he pops up through the ground] That was a lot scarier a second ago. [as they look at Pym Technologies building map]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: It looks like the Futures lab has its own isolated power supply.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Theres a security guard posted around the clock, well need you to take him out to deactivate the security systems. [shrunk again and back under the earth, Scott goes looking for more ants]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Okay. Whos next? [a massive ant comes up behind Scott]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Paraponera clavata.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: I know. Bullet ants, right? Number one on the Schmidt pain index. [to the ants] Hey, guys! Remember me from the bedroom? [as the ant goes to attack Scott pops back up the through the ground in his normal size] Whoa! [return to the Pym Technologies building map]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: The Yellowjacket pod is hermetically sealed and the only access point is a tube we estimate to be about five millimeters in diameter.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Why do I have a sick feeling in my stomach?

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: The tube is protected by a laser grid and we can only power that down for fifteen seconds.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Youre going to need to signal the crazy ants to blow the servers, retrieve the suit, and exit the vaults, before the backup power comes on. [return to training]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: [looking at another ant] Camponotus pennsylvanicus.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Alternatively known as a carpenter ant. Ideal for ground and air transport.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Wait a minute, I know this guy. Im going to call him Ant-thony.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Thats good. Thats very good, because this time youre really going to have to learn how to control him. [we see the ants pushing sugar cubes on the table] Tell them to put the sugar in the teacup. [we see Hope and Scott fight training, this time Scott lands a painful blow to Hope]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Oh, you okay, d… [Hope suddenly punches Scott in the face and then knocks him down with her legs] [later as Scott is tending to his wound]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Hank wants you outside for target practice.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: The suit has no weapons so I made you these discs. Red shrinks. Blue enlarges.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: [referring to another species of ant] Solenopsis mandibularis.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Known for their bite, the fire ants have evolved into remarkable architects. They are handy to get you in and out of difficult places. [back to Scott trying to get some ants to put the sugar cubes into the teacup]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: You can do it Scott, come on. [one of the ants flies off and Scott takes off his earpiece in frustration]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Theyre not listening to me.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: You have to commit, you have to mean it. No shortcuts, no lies.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Throwing insults into the mix will not do anyone any good, Hope.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: We dont have time for coddling.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Our focus should be on helping Scott!

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Really? Is that where our focus should be? [Hope picks up the earpiece and uses it to instruct the ants to put the sugar cube into the teacup, then she gets a herd of ants to appear]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hope! [looking upset Hope walks over to Pym]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: I dont know why I came to you in the first place. [Hope leaves]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: We cant do this without her. [as Hope is about to leave in her car Scott gets in]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Oh, God.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: You gotta lock your doors. I mean, really. Theres some weird folks in this neighborhood.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Do you think this is a joke? Do you have any idea what hes asking you to risk? You have a daughter.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Im doing this for her.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: You know when my mother died I didnt see him for two weeks?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: He was in grief.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Yeah, so was I, and I was seven. And he never came back, not in any way that counted. He just sent me off to boarding school. You know, I thought, with all thats at stake, just maybe we might have a chance at making peace. But even now he still wants to shut me out.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: He doesnt want to shut you out. He trusts you.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Then why are you here?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: It proves that he loves you. Hope. Look at me. Im expendable, thats why Im here. You mustve realized that by now. I mean, thats why Im in the suit and youre not. Hed rather lose than fight than lose you. Anyway… [Scott goes to get out of the car]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: You know, I didnt know you had a… a daughter when I called the cops on you. Whats her name?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Cassie.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Its a pretty name. You have to clear your mind, Scott. You have to make your thoughts precise, thats how it works. Think about Cassie, about how badly you want to see her, and use that to focus. [she gives Scott the earpiece back to talk to the ants and places a coin on the dashboard] Open your eyes and just think about what you want the ants to do. [couple of ants arrive and Scott gets them to pick up the coin] Thats good. [they watch as Scott gets the ants to spin the coin] [Hope and Scott enter back into the house where Pym is waiting]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Your mother convinced me to let her join me on my missions. They called her the Wasp. She was born to it. And theres not a day that goes by that I dont regret having said yes. It was 1987, separatists had hijacked a Soviet missile silo in Kursk and launched an ICBM at the United States. The only way to the internal mechanics was through solid titanium. [in flashback we see Pym in his Ant-Man suit and his wife in her Wasp suit intercepted the missile]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I knew I had to shrink between the molecules to disarm the missile, but my regulator had sustained too much damage. Your mother, she didnt hesitate. [we see Janet shrinking herself to stop the missile]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Janet! No! [flash-forward]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: She turned off her regulator and went sub-atomic to deactivate the bomb. She was gone. Your mom died a hero. And I spent the next ten years trying to learn all I could about the quantum realm.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: You were trying to bring her back.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: But all I learned was we know nothing.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Its not your fault. She made her choice. But why didnt you tell me this sooner?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: I was trying to protect you. I lost your mother. I didnt mean to lose you too. [Hope begins to cry]

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Im sorry.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: This is awesome. Its awesome, you know? You guys are breaking down walls, youre healing. Its important. [Hope and Pym turn to look at him] I ruined the moment didnt I?

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Yes, you did, yes.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Im gonna make some tea. [Scott turns and leaves] [we see Scott finally shrink down and dive through the keyhole]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Nailed it! [he then goes under the earth, gets to fly on an ant]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Thats a good boy, Ant-thony. [we see him successfully work with the ants getting them to follow him]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: The final phase of your training will be a stealth incursion. [we see Scott in his shrunken form on the side of a plane]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Its freezing! You couldnt make a suit with a flannel lining? [back in Pyms lab]

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: We must retrieve this prototype of a signal decoy, its a device that I invented from my SHIELD days.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: We need it to counteract the transmission blockers that Cross installed in the Futures vault.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Its currently collecting dust in one of Howard Starks old storage facilities in upstate New York. Should be a piece of cake. [back to plane]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Youre over the target area. Disengage, now, Scott. [back on the plane Scott instructs the ants]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Squadron A, go. B, go. C, go. Alright, Ant-thony, please dont drop me this time. [they jump off the plane] Ah, it feels like a big leap from sugar cubes to this.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Stay calm.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Uh, guys, we might have a problem. Hank, didnt you say this was some old warehouse? Its not! [we see that the warehouse is the new Avengers base] You son of a bitch!

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Scott, get out of there.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Abort! Abort now.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: No, its okay. It doesnt look like anyones home. Ant-thony, get me to the roof.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Hes gonna lose the suit.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Hes gonna lose his life. [Scott lands in the roof of the new Avengers base]

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Alright Im on the roof of the target building.

Speaker: Hope van Dyne
Content: Somebodys home, Scott. [just then Sam Wilson in his Falcon flies in]

Speaker: Voice over Radio
Content: [on Sams radio] Whats going on down there, Sam?

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Its the Falcon!

Speaker: Sam Wilson
Content: [into his radio] I had a sensor trip but Im not seeing anything. Wait a second.

Speaker: Dr. Hank Pym
Content: Abort, Scott! Abort now.

Speaker: Scott Lang
Content: Its okay, he cant see me.

Speaker: Sam Wilson
Content: I can see you.
